**Wedit** uses static HTML website as template and allows the content to be changed through **WYSIWYG** editing using the web browser.

All changes are immediate and align with the intended website design.

To see it in action, press and hold the `CTRL` key!

#### Text editing Edit through markdown using paragraphs, [links](http://wedit.io), headers, bullet points, `basic` **text** *decorations*, inline images or even HTML. ```
...
``` #### Repeat sections Replicated same section multiple times with different content. ```
 
    ...  
``` #### Site-wide content Mark content as available for the whole website, so changes are applied to all pages. ```
  ...
``` #### Images Supports ``  elements. ``` ``` If `srcset` is used with 'width' descriptor (like `srcset="image-s.jpg 320w, image-m.jpg 640w, image-l.jpg 1024w"`), the new uploaded image will be automatically resized and different files will be supplied for each descriptor. #### Includes Append entire HTML fragments from separate files to include similar sections in different pages. ```
``` #### New pages Generating new pages using common parent template. For example `/posts/` template is used for pages `/posts/post1/` and `/posts/post2/`. Just enter he desire page path and `wedit` will fine the closest parent template and use it for the new page. #### Custom shell scripts Configure custom shell scripts available for triggering during content edit like publish (git commit and push) or reset (git reset). --- You can find full documentation and instructions in the project's [GitHub repository](https://github.com/sofmon/wedit "GitHub repository").

The **wedit** tool is free and open source, under an **MIT license**.

Source code and documentation can be found on the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/sofmon/wedit "title").

There are some things you can help us out with:

- [Homebrew](https://brew.sh/) package
- Report a bugs or do a feature requests

Checkout the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/sofmon/wedit "GitHub repository").

**Wedit** is currently maintained by:

- Haralampi Staykov - [About](https://haralampi.com) - [GitHub](https://github.com/sofmon/) - [LinkedIn](https://linkedin.com/in/haralampi/)

#### Go get

[Go](https://golang.org) must be installed and configured

`$ go get github.com/sofmon/wedit`

---
#### Custom
[Go](https://golang.org) and [Dart](https://dartlang.org) must be installed and configured

`$ git clone github.com/sofmon/wedit`

`$ ./build.sh` for Linux/MacOS

`$ ./build.ps1`  for Windows
